fields.description:
With all the new features in ag-grid, implementing a total footer is difficult, prone to errors, and very susceptible to breaking changes in new releases.

fields.customfield_10522:
Before the grid used to have it's own layout manager instead of using CSS flex. This had the following drawbacks:
+ The grid had a timer where every 500ms it was checking the width and height of the grid and then laying out contents again if the width or height changed.
+ Extra DIV elements were required for the layout.

Now CSS Flex is used. The timer is not longer needed. The DOM is much more clean.
fields.summary: Grid now using Flex for layout

fields.customfield_10520: Previous versions of ag-Grid checked the grid's size every 500ms to know how big the viewport was, to know how many rows and columns were needed for the row/column virtualisation. This has no been replaced with using ResizeObserver (or a polyfill we created when it is missing). This mean the polling every 500ms is no longer needed.

fields.description:
Sean, this is tipping your toes in the deep end, but on purpose, to get you more involved with the core part.

Basically the grid has two modes of operation that are controlled using two CSS classes ag-layout-auto-height and ag-layout-normal. You will see these mentioned in ag-grid.scss to assign different CSS to different depending on which one is active.

For this, take a look at the layout for auto height, see if it makes sense to apply a min-height as the customer suggests. Then play around with the grid eg add zero rows, 2 rows, 100 rows, open/close tool panel, see how it all works. Test on all browsers FF/Chrome/IE/Safari latest versions only needed. I can code review.
fields.summary: domLayout='autoHeight' issues when grid is empty

fields.customfield_10522:
It is not really a bug, what is happening here is that the grid is remembering which row is focused, this is valid since you could have a button that works on the focused row and the grid would remember which row was focused.

This can be fixed by calling api.clearFocus()
fields.summary: Row Focus - Tabbing out of first/lat row leaves the row focused on the grid

fields.description:
currenly getRowNode(id) only works for in memory.

for all the others, if the row node is in memory, should return it back.

in viewport, it's easy, just iterate through everything in rownode, then get it to return if found.

for infinite and enterprise, could do a simple forEachNode() and return when you find the node (not efficient), or you could create a id->node map for each block, and then ask each block in turn if it has the node (more code but efficient).
fields.customfield_10522: gridOptions.api.getRowNode(id) is now supported across all Row Models.
fields.summary: [rowNode] have getRowNode(id) work with all row models

fields.description:
Can be seen when using the react dev tools

componentDidUnmount is called, but we're not (I believe) removing the item from the DOM. I'll bet this is similar to the angular1 leak I fixed recently

Whoever picks this up (probably me) - you'll need to create a local example for this. the react dev tools dont work in plunker

Not 100% this is a react only issue either - whoever picks this up should investigate the other frameworks too. I suspect once we id and fix the issue it'll be fixed across the board
fields.summary: Grid not releasing React components in DOM

fields.description: This is because we have to many support issues with angular 1. So really we want to reduce support, how can we do this? Is it change example runner to support angular 1 (big effort), or maybe we improve the getting started sections? or change the grid somehow to better support angular 1?
fields.summary: Investigate lowering ng1 support, eg example runner in angular 1?
